  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/offloading/amdgpu/amdgpukernelmetadata">AMDGPUKernelMetaData</a></>}>
Struct for holding metadata related to <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu">AMDGPU</a> kernels, for more information about the metadata and its meaning see: <a href="https://llvm.org/docs/AMDGPUUsage.html#code-object-v3">https://llvm.org/docs/AMDGPUUsage.html#code-object-v3</a>. <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/offloading/amdgpu/amdgpukernelmetadata/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

### isImageCompatibleWithEnv() {#ad772ba5923d08e11379f06cc8c3c5e4d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::offloading::amdgpu::isImageCompatibleWithEnv (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> ImageArch, uint32&#95;t ImageFlags, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> EnvTargetID)</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if an image is compatible with current system&#39;s environment.

The system environment is given as a &#39;target-id&#39; which has the form:

&lt;target-id&gt; := &lt;processor&gt; ( &quot;:&quot; &lt;target-feature&gt; ( &quot;+&quot; | &quot;-&quot; ) )&#42;

If a feature is not specific as &#39;+&#39; or &#39;-&#39; it is assumed to be in an &#39;any&#39; and is compatible with either &#39;+&#39; or &#39;-&#39;. The HSA runtime returns this information using the target-id, while we use the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/elf">ELF</a> header to determine these features.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/frontend/include/llvm/frontend/offloading/utility-h/#l00111">111</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/frontend/include/llvm/frontend/offloading/utility-h">Utility.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/frontend/lib/frontend/offloading/utility-cpp/#l00151">151</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/frontend/lib/frontend/offloading/utility-cpp">Utility.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
